summary: Through its Paycheck Protection Program and Economic Injury Disaster Loans, the Small Business Administration has provided about $968 billion to small businesses hurt by COVID-19 . SBA streamlined the programs to speed fund distribution. However, this meant less oversight and left the programs more susceptible to payment errors and fraud. This testimony includes updates on improvements SBA has made in response to identified weaknesses and...
title: COVID-19 Loans: SBA Has Begun to Take Steps to Improve Oversight and Fraud Risk Management
